items.headline: I’m 44. I have $400K in cash, plus rental properties in Dubai. I’m worried about a stock-market crash. Do I dare invest?
items.summary_en: “My rental properties generate passive income of $6,000 monthly after taxes.”

items.headline: Why Gundlach says it’s a very unusual market — and what bonds he likes now

items.headline: ‘Gold is like the art market,’ declares Citi, as it hikes its target price again.

items.headline: The EV tax credit expires today — and time’s running out to save money on these other green upgrades. Here’s what to do.

items.headline: This chart shows the U.S. labor market is running on fumes. Why that’s a risk for the stock market.
items.summary_en: A weakening U.S. labor market is a risk for both the U.S. economy and markets right now. But the most closely watched numbers — the rate of new jobs created, and the official unemployment rate — don’t tell the full story.

items.headline: This stock and bond strategy is so disliked — and it’s probably your best investment move for the next 10 years
items.summary_en: In the past, when the market was overvalued as it is now, a 60/40 portfolio almost always beat the S&P 500 over the subsequent decade.

items.headline: You won’t get a paper Social Security check in October — or ever again. Here’s how you’ll be paid instead.
